problems.title: Contains Duplicate Iii (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
You are given an integer array nums and two integers indexDiff and valueDiff.
Find a pair of indices (i, j) such that:
i != j,
abs(i - j) <= indexDiff,
abs(nums[i] - nums[j]) <= valueDiff.
Return true if such pair exists or false otherwise.

Input Format:
First line: three integers n, indexDiff, valueDiff.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print "true" if such pair exists, otherwise "false".
hintsList: Think about how to use a sliding window to optimize the solution.
Consider using a frequency map or two pointers to track the window state.
